The Informant Agreement Ratio is an index for testing homogeneity of knowledge [ 75]
IAR = Nur − Nt/( Nur − 1) (2) where Nur refers to the number of use-reports for a particular use category and Nt refers to the number of taxa used for a particular use category by all informants. IAR values are low (approaching 0) if plants are used randomly or if there is no exchange of information about their use among informants. IAR values are high (approaching 1) when there is a well-defined selection criterion in the community and/or if information is exchanged between informants [ 75].
